name: Peppered Pecans
author: JJOYB53
summary: I like this roasted nut recipe because it doesn't use any added oil or butter - my husband likes this because it's nice and spicy!  These have become a Thanksgiving tradition at our house, and make a tasty (albeit unusual)  addition to salads, especially with the Maple Balsamic Vinaigrette from this site.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
directions: Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Spray a large heavy roasting pan with cooking spray
Mix black pepper, white pepper, cayenne pepper, paprika, and dried thyme in a small bowl
Whisk egg whites in a large bowl until foamy
Add Worcestershire, hot sauce, and liquid smoke flavoring and whisk to mix
Drop in pecans and stir to coat well
Pour coated pecans into a colander to drain off extra egg white mixture; return to bowl and add the pepper mixture
Stir well to coat each pecan with spices
Spread pecans in prepared roasting pan
Roast in preheated oven for 5 minutes and stir pecans; roast an additional 5 minutes and stir again
Turn off heat and roast pecans an additional 5 to 10 minutes until pecans are lightly browned and fragrant
Let cool and serve at room temperature
